message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.LG, cs.DC, cs.SE 

This paper is primarily focused on the security aspects of IoT devices, specifically using anomaly detection to identify potential attacks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the use of blockchain technology for collaborative anomaly detection, which falls under the category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper proposes a lightweight framework for anomaly detection, which involves machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely category as well. The paper also discusses the use of distributed and collaborative techniques, which falls under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Finally, the paper proposes a framework for updating the anomaly detection model, which involves software engineering techniques, making cs.SE (Software Engineering) a possible category as well.
